metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8364 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the ff_ivi_init_planes function in libavcodec/ivi.c in FFmpeg before 2.6.5, 2.7.x before 2.7.3, and 2.8.x through 2.8.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds heap-memory access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted image dimensions in Indeo Video Interactive data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8364` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.3-1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.3-1
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.3-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> no equivalent fix in libav as of 2016-03-31 in precise, code is in ivi_common.c ebarretto> as of 2018-09-27, no equivalent fix in libav

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.3-1').
